snippet: The number of patients at Brooklyn’s Long Island College Hospital has dwindled to 18 amid a legal stalemate between its owner, which wants to close it, and unions representing workers.
abstract: Number of patients at Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn has dwindled to 18 amid a legal stalemate between its owner SUNY Downstate, which wants to close it, and unions representing workers; hospital's grim fate illustrates how health care is changing in New York and in the country, as hospitals confront seismic changes in patient care and how it is financed.
lead_paragraph: The number of patients at Brooklyn’s Long Island College Hospital has dwindled to 18 amid a legal stalemate between its owner, which wants to close it, and unions representing workers.

headline.main: Nurses Roam Empty Halls as Long Island College Hospital Is Prepared to Close
headline.print_headline: Doctors and Nurses Roam Empty Halls As Hospital Again Prepares for Its Closing
